commitResults.messageTitle: Fix JavaDoc formatting in SleeperException class
Fix JavaDoc formatting for methods in Parser class
Improve JavaDoc formatting and validation logic
commitResults.messageBody:
The Storage class currently lacks proper JavaDoc
formatting. The loadTasks method lacks proper
explanation of its implementation.

Refactor the JavaDoc comments in all the methods of
the Storage class to improve clarity and follow the
convention. Create an isValidTaskLine method for better
abstraction and improve logic flow.

As a result, the code will be more maintainable
and easier to understand for future developers.

commitResults.messageTitle: Rename class and improve code quality
commitResults.messageBody:
The class is currently named Events, which implies
a collection. There are unclear variable names such
as parts and remaining. Lack out of bounds index exception
handling.

The plural name Events should not be used for a class
name. Out of bounds index can cause the program to
crash.

Rename the class from `Events` to `Event`. Refactor
the constructor to catch `ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException`.
Add detailed comments explaining the two-step splitting
strategy used to separate the description from the time
arguments.

This standardises the naming convention, explains the logic
and handles out of bounds index.

commitResults.messageTitle: Handle load errors
commitResults.messageBody:
The Sleeper constructor currently leaves the task list
uninitialized if storage.loadTasks() fails.

This will lead to NullPointerExceptions.

Wrap the task loading logic in a try-catch block to
handle exceptions. Initialise a new empty ArrayList
if loading fails.

This ensures the application starts safely even if
the save or load file is corrupted or missing
